story:
Once upon a time, in a small village in Nigeria, there was a kind and curious little girl named Ada. Ada loved to explore the world around her and ask questions about everything she saw. She spent her days playing in the fields and forests, learning about the plants and animals that lived there.

One day, Ada was playing near the river that ran through the village when she saw a beautiful bird with brightly colored feathers. The bird was perched on a branch, singing a sweet song. Ada was captivated by the bird's beauty and approached it slowly, so as not to scare it away.

As she got closer, the bird looked down at her and spoke in a soft, gentle voice. "Greetings, little one," it said. "I am the River Bird, the guardian of the waters. I have been watching over this river for many years, and I have great knowledge of its secrets and mysteries."

Ada was amazed and delighted to hear the bird speak. "Please, River Bird," she said. "Will you tell me some of the river's secrets? I promise to keep them and use them to help my village."

The River Bird considered Ada's request and then nodded its head. "Very well, little one," it said. "But first, you must promise me one thing. You must promise to always respect and protect the river, for it is a sacred and vital part of our world. Do you agree to this?"

Ada nodded eagerly. "Yes, River Bird," she said. "I promise to always protect and respect the river."

The River Bird smiled and then began to tell Ada about the river's secrets. It told her about the creatures that lived in its depths, and the treasures that could be found hidden beneath its waves. It told her about the magic that flowed through its waters, and the healing powers it held.

Ada listened carefully to every word, and as the River Bird spoke, she felt a deep connection to the river and a desire to protect and cherish it. She thanked the River Bird for its wisdom and promised to use it to help her village.

And so, Ada became the guardian of the river, using the knowledge she had gained to protect it and ensure its health and vitality. She became a hero in her village, and all the people looked up to her with respect and admiration.

From that day on, Ada spent every day by the river, watching over it and making sure that it was always clean and healthy. And as she grew older, she passed on her knowledge to the next generation, ensuring that the river would be protected and cherished for many years to come.

The end.

Goodnight my dear, may you grow up to be curious and kind like Ada and take care of our nature. Sleep tight.
